China dingcong8866@163.com † These authors contributed equally to this work. 29 9 2025 474398 14 7 2025 3 9 2025 29 09 2025 30 09 2025 01 10 2025 This journal is © The Royal Society of Chemistry 2025 RSC https://www.rsc.org/journals-books-databases/author-and-reviewer-hub/authors-information/licences-copyright-permissions/ This journal is © The Royal Society of Chemistry. You must request permission to use material from this article in other publications, see RSC reuse permissions guidance HMOX1 has gained increasing recognition across multiple malignancies; however, its precise oncogenic or tumor-suppressive roles remain incompletely defined. In this study, we comprehensively investigated HMOX1 across diverse tumor types utilizing the cancer genome atlas (TCGA). We further integrated data from multiple bioinformatics platforms, including TIMER2, UALCAN, GEPIA2, cBioPortal, R, GSCA, and LinkedOmics. Western blotting and quantitative real-time PCR (qRT-PCR) confirmed differential HMOX1 expression between normal renal epithelial cells and KIRC cells. Functional assays in vitro in vivo P P P −4 + ρ −8 ρ −13 in vitro in vivo This study performs a pan-cancer analysis of Heme oxygenase 1 (HMOX1) to examine its expression patterns, prognostic value, and therapeutic links in various cancers, with a focus on kidney renal clear cell carcinoma (KlRC).
